Package io.crums.sldg

Class Ledgers

java.lang.Object
io.crums.sldg.Ledgers
public class Ledgers
extends java.lang.Object
Convenience methods for creating or loading skip ledgers.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static Ledger newLedger​(java.io.File file)
    Creates a new or loads an existing ledger at the given file path.
    static Ledger newLedger​(java.io.File file, io.crums.io.Opening mode)
    Creates a new or loads an existing ledger at the given file path with the given opening mode.
    static Ledger newLedger​(java.io.File file, io.crums.io.Opening mode, boolean lazy)
    Creates a new or loads an existing ledger at the given file path with the given opening mode.
    static Ledger newVolatileLedger()
    Creates and returns an in-memory, volatile ledger.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • newLedger

      public static Ledger newLedger​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.IOException
      Creates a new or loads an existing ledger at the given file path.
      Parameters:

      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • newLedger

      public static Ledger newLedger​(java.io.File file, io.crums.io.Opening mode) throws java.io.IOException
      Creates a new or loads an existing ledger at the given file path with the given opening mode.
      Parameters:
      file - path to a regular file
      mode - non-null
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • newLedger

      public static Ledger newLedger​(java.io.File file, io.crums.io.Opening mode, boolean lazy) throws java.io.IOException
      Creates a new or loads an existing ledger at the given file path with the given opening mode.

      By default, Row instances are not lazily loaded, i.e. they're pre-loaded, since if the row is to be serialized externally anyway, it's better to fetch the data immediately while "disk" caches are still hot. If the user however is just scanning rows, then the lazy version generally performs better.

      Parameters:
      file - path to a regular file
      mode - non-null
      lazy - if true then the row's hashpointers are lazily loaded (false by default)
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • newVolatileLedger

      public static Ledger newVolatileLedger()
      Creates and returns an in-memory, volatile ledger. This may find other uses; for now it's used mostly in testing.
